global.currentlyNotLoggedIn: You are currently not logged in.
global.loginWithDiscordDesc: You need to log in with Discord. Due to recent changes, it's now more difficult to access mutual guilds without being logged in. Please click the login button to continue or [here](https://api.supportmail.dev/discord/login).
global.reportToDeveloper: Please report this issue to the [developer](https://discord.gg/rFkVQx3vpj).
global.premiumRequired: You need SupportMail Premium for this!

errors.unknownError: An unknown error occured. Please contact the developer.
errors.somethingWentWrongErrorBelow: Something went wrong. The error is shown below.

There has been a token revocation error.
Please notify the [bot support](https://discord.gg/rFkVQx3vpj).

errors.ticketNotCloseRequested: Ticket close not requested. Something feels wrong here...
errors.ticketsPausedUntil: Tickets are currently not enabled. Try again <t:{timestamp}:R>.
errors.reportsPausedUntil: Reports are currently not enabled. Try again <t:{timestamp}:R>.
errors.ongoingTicketCreationProcess: You are already creating a ticket on another server. Please finish this process first or cancel it.
errors.ongoingReportForThisMessage: There is an ongoing report for this message. Please wait.
errors.youCantReportMe: You can't report me. What are you trying to achieve? ðŸ¤¨
errors.maxReportsInGuildReached: Maximum number of open reports in the guild reached. Try again later or contact the server staff.
errors.maxReportsCreated: Maximum number of open reports created. Please wait until one of the reports is resolved.
errors.maxReportsReceivedForUser: You can report this user anymore since they have reached the maximum number of open reports.
errors.notAuthorized: Who do you think you are? You are not authorized to do this!
errors.reportAlreadyBeingEdited: Report is already being edited. Please wait.
errors.youCantTakeActionOnYourself: You can't take action on yourself.
errors.memberNotFound: Member not found. (Not in Server anymore)
errors.noPermissionsToManageSub: You don't have permissions to manage this subscription.

Multiple subscriptions for one guild found.

errors.ongoingPaymentProcess: There is an ongoing payment process. Please wait.

No subscription found.

Roles were already debugged a few minutes ago.

errors.debuggingCooldown-users:

You are not logged in or you don't share any servers with me.

tickets.selectServerDesc: Select a server where you want to continue in an open ticket or create a new one.
tickets.blacklistedDesc: -# You can't create new tickets in this server.
tickets.modmailExplanation: What is Modmail? Click here to learn more.
tickets.userFeedbackWillBeSentHere: User feedback will be sent in here.
tickets.autoForwardingGuildExplanaition: If enabled, messages in a ticket will be automatically forwarded to the user.
setupSuccessDesc: Remember that you can always change the settings with the commands.
Change staff members/roles by allowing/denying the `VIEW_CHANNEL` permission for each member/role in <#{forumId}>.
- Set up Custom Messages for Ticket creation/closure
userDetailsAnonym: -# This is just an nickname/alias chosen by the bot. The real username is not visible.
However, the user can still be blacklisted from creating tickets by providing this ticket id (`ticketid`) when using {command:blacklist add}.
tickets.closedAutomaticallyToDMFailed: Ticket closed automatically. Failed to send the message to the user.
tickets.deleteCloseReqAndCloseTicket: Delete close request and close ticket?
tickets.closeRequestDescription:
The user can now accept or deny the close request.

> To revoke the close request, execute {command:close-request delete} or send another message you want to send to the user.
tickets.ticketAutoCloseIfNoResponse: The ticket will be automatically closed if the user doesn't respond until <t:{closeTime}> (<t:{closeTime}:R>).
tickets.acceptOrDenyCloseRequest: Accept or deny the close request.
tickets.usersCanCreateTicketsAnon: Users can create tickets anonymously. Read more about it [here](https://docs.supportmail.dev/f/tickets/anonymous)
tickets.feedbackThankYou:
### Thanks for sharing your thoughts!
Unfortunately, we won't be able to respond to your feedback.

reports.reportsChannelDesc: The channel where created reports will be sent to.
reports.reportIsBeingCreated: Report is being created. Please wait.
reports.reportHaveBeenSentToYourDMs: The Report details have been sent to your DMs.
reports.couldNotSendYouTheReportData: Could not send you the report data.
actionsExplanation: Mods can take action on a report: **ban**, **kick**, **timeout** or **ignore**. **Ignoring** is always an option.
This setting is enabled by default.
If this setting is disabled, mods can only decide between **resolve** (without any action) and **ignore**.
We recommend disabling this setting if you want to handle reports yourself.
guidedReportsSetupInstructions: You will now be guided through the setup process step-by-step.
You can always change each setting later with the command {command:config reports}.
If you want to skip a step, click the button **Skip**.
-# If you are already familiar with the bot, you can also use the command {command:setup reports quick}.
Press the button below to start the setup.
reports.changeConfigWithCommand: You can change the configuration with the command {command:config reports}.
reports.pingsExplanation: The roles and users configured here will be pinged when a report is created.
reports.immunesExplanation: The users and roles configured here will be immune to reports.
reports.modsExplanation: The users and roles configured here will be able to take action on reports.
specialChannelsExplanation: You can configure special channels to either exclude set channels from reports or to include only set channels in reports.
That means, if you exclude channels, no one will be able to report messages in these channels.
If you include channels, reports on messages can only be created in these channels.
You can change the setting (excluded/included) below and select the channels below.
limitsExplanation: You can limit the following numbers:
- Maximum open reports a user can create \*
- Maximum reports a user can receive
- Maximum open reports in the server
-# \* Example: The limit for open created reports per user is `5` and a user has already created `5` reports. This means that he cannot create any more until at least one of them has been resolved.
notificationLevelExplanation: You can configure if and how much information an author of a report will receive.
- `Anonym`: Only a generic "Action Taken" message will be sent.
- `Only Report`: Like `Anonym`, but the Report ID will also be sent.
- `Only Action`: Like `Anonym`, but the action taken will also be sent.
- `Full`: The Report ID and the action taken will be sent.
reports.onlyThatSomeActionHasBeenTaken: Only that an action has been taken.
reports.OnlyActionNotWhichReport: Only the action taken, not which report.
reports.reportsNotPossibleInTheseChannels: Reports are not possible in these channels
reports.reportsOnlyPossibleInTheseChannels: Reports are only possible in these channels
reports.commentPlaceholder: Any additional context to support your reason (text is good, image links are better)
reports.reportResolvedWithTimestamp: Your report from <t:{timestamp}:R> has been resolved.

commands.reportChannelInfo: The channel where created reports will be sent to.
commands.PanelControlsDesc: Decide if you want to edit an already existing panel or create a new one.
commands.responsesAreNotAnonymByDefault: Responses are not anonymous by default.
anonym-enabled: Ticket responses will be sent anonymously.
commands.anonym-disabled: Ticket responses will be sent with the team member's username.
commands.customMessageExampleBelow: An example of the custom message is shown below.
commands.setupTicketWithCommand: You can set up tickets with the command {command:setup tickets quick} or {command:setup tickets guided}.
commands.userFeedbackTurnedOff: User feedback has been turned off.
commands.editPanelWithButtonsBelow: Edit the panel with the buttons below.
commands.panelDataIsVisibleBelow: The panel data is visible below.
commands.updateButtonStyleDesc: Examples are shown below. Click on the button which you want to use.
commands.setupStaffDesc: Select the staff members who should be able to see the ticket forum. (You can change this manually later.)
commands.fixPermissionsAndTryAgain: Please fix the permissions below and try again.
commands.autoForwardingEnabledByDefault: Auto forwarding is enabled by default.
commands.selectMenuIssueNotice:
> If the pre-selected values are the same, go to another channel and come straight back. This should fix the problem.
-# :information_source: This is just a notice about this bug. You can click to dismiss this message.
commands.pleaseFinishTheSetup: Please finish the setup or dismiss this message to cancel it.
commands.editQuestionsWithButtonsBelow: Edit the questions with the buttons below.
commands.changeQuestionToEditWithselectMenuBelow: Change the question to edit with the select menu below.
welcomeToGuidedSetup: Here the bot will guide you through the setup process.
Only the first step is required, the rest is optional. Optional steps can be skipped by clicking the button "Skip".
You can always change the settings later with the command {command:config tickets}.
Press the button below to start the guided setup.
-# If you are already familiar with the bot, you can also use the command {command:setup tickets quick}.
commands.questionLabelPlaceholder: The Question you are asking the user
commands.phPlaceholder: The placeholder text in the input field
commands.minCharsPlaceholder: Minimum number of characters the user has to type in.
commands.maxCharsPlaceholder: Maximum number of characters the user can type in.
commands.changeSelectionBelowToChangeConfig: Change the selection below to change the configuration.
commands.thatsTheLastStep: That's the last step. Your previously selected settings will be applied after you're done with this step.
alreadySubscribed: This server already has **Gold** because of <@{buyerId}>.
-# The current billing period ends on <t:{nextPaymentTS}> (<t:{nextPaymentTS}:R>).
subscriptionCanceled: -# _The server will keep the benefits until the end of the billing period._
### You can reactivate Premium at any time by purchasing **Gold** again for this server as soon as the current billing period has expired.
commands.stillEligibleForRefund: You're still eligible for a refund.
checkoutInstructions: Please complete the checkout within 15 minutes - otherwise, the session will expire.
Please **do not** share this link with anyone else as it is unique to you.
-# This checkout session holds your Discord data - if anyone else completes the checkout with this link, it will look like you bought the subscription.
checkoutLegalNotice: By completing the checkout, you agree to the [Terms of Service](https://supportmail.dev/legal/terms) and the [Privacy Policy](https://supportmail.dev/legal/privacy).
-# This policy states, amongst other things, that you can only request a refund within 14 days of purchase.
commands.confirmSubCancellation: Are you sure you want to cancel the subscription?
commands.blacklistRemoveDecide-user: From which blacklist do you want to remove the user?
commands.blacklistRemoveDecide-role: From which blacklist do you want to remove the role?
commands.blacklistRemoveSuccessMultiple: Successfully removed {firstmention} and {morecount} more from the blacklist.
commands.maybeTheProvidedPageNumberIsWrong: Maybe the provided page number is wrong.
commands.blacklistClearConfirmation: Are you sure you want to clear `{count}` blacklist entries for `{module}`?
commands.resetConfigsInstructions: Select the configs you want to reset below. Keep calm, you have to confirm this action.
commands.oldFollowedChannelsAreNotReset: Please note, that any previously followed channels are not reset. You have to unfollow them manually.
commands.runCommandAgainAfterLogin: Please run the command again after you logged in.
newLanguageSet: Note that this language is only used when you interact with the bot by sending messages. When you use buttons, select menus, or forms, the language of your Discord App will be used.
-# Please also note that not all languages are supported. See the [list of supported languages](<https://github.com/The-LukeZ/supportmail-locales?tab=readme-ov-file#currently-supported-languages>).
autoRedirectActivated: Your direct messages will now be automatically redirected to the last active ticket.
> **Note:** If you want to create a new ticket and you already have an open ticket, you must use the {command:ticket-create} command.
autoRedirectDeactivated: You will now have to confirm where your message should be sent to.
> **Note:** If you reply to a message from an open ticket, your message will still be sent directly to the ticket.
selectPlanDescription: The difference between the plans is the length of the billing period and the price.
commands.selectBlacklistToClear: # Select the blacklist you want to clear
reallyResetBlacklist: ### Are you sure you want to reset the `{module}` blacklist?

config.customMessagesNote: Due to the nature of the system, you currently have to use {command:config tickets} to review and edit the custom messages.

Users can give feedback after a ticket has been closed.
The feedback will then be sent into {channel}.
question: **Label:** {label}

**Style:** `{style}`

>>> {placeholder}
config.mods: Moderators (they can take action on reports)

help.moreInformation: For more information, visit the [SupportMail Documentation](https://docs.supportmail.dev/) and ask in the [Support Server](https://discord.gg/rFkVQx3vpj) if there are still questions.
help.helpUsTranslate: -# :checkered_flag: If you want to help us translate the Documentation, please join our Suppport Server as well and ask in the [translator chat](https://discord.com/channels/1064594649668395128/1294623837614379069)
help.resourceCouldNotBeTranslated: -# This resource could not be translated yet.
help.readTheFollowingArticles: ### Please read the following articles to get more information:
commands: -# This is only necessary if you have activated automatic forwarding.
- {command:close-request create} - Request to close a ticket
- {command:blacklist add} - Add a user/role to a blacklist
- {command:blacklist remove} - Remove a user/role from a blacklist
-# There are more subcommands available - type `/blacklist` to view them.
-# These commands have additional subcommands. Type them in to get more information and [read the docs](<https://docs.supportmail.dev/f/tickets/setup>).
-# There are more subcommands available - type `/config tags` to view them.
- {command:config blacklist} - Manage Blacklist settings and reset entries
- {command:debug} - Debug specific settings (e.g. roles, users, configs)
about: SupportMail is a Discord bot designed to make your life easier with modmail-style ticket management and reports.

The idea was not new, but I (thelukez, the owner) wanted to create a bot that supports more than one language, is easy to use, customizable, modern and has all the important features available for free. It was originally planned for a CS2 server I was going to open in 2023, but that never happened.
It started as a Python Project but was later rewritten in TypeScript (2024) to make it more efficient and to be able to offer more features.
I've always been very open to feedback and suggestions, so if you have any, feel free to join the [Support Server](https://discord.gg/rFkVQx3vpj) and let me know.
